required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Unplanned-extubation in the ICU; Incidence, Characteristics and Prognosis. Success And Failure of Self-Extubation in the ICU
clinical_study.official_title: Unplanned-extubation in the Intensive Care Unit; Incidence, Characteristics and Prognosis.

lead_sponsor.agency: Société Française d'Anesthésie et de Réanimation

clinical_study.source: Société Française d'Anesthésie et de Réanimation

brief_summary.textblock: Our study consists of a national observational study assessing quantitatively (incidence) and qualitatively unscheduled extubation in intensive care unit. In addition, we will compare the outcome of patients with "success" or "failure" in the self-extubation subgroup.

primary_outcome.description: Quantitative description of unscheduled extubation episodes in intensive care unit

secondary_outcome.description: Qualitative description of unscheduled extubation episodes in intensive care unit
To assess factors associated with re-intubation
To assess the incidence of severe hemodynamic and respiratory events of immediate onset

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of stay in intensive care unit, the duration of mechanical ventilation and mortality
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the length of stay in intensive care unit, the duration of mechanical ventilation as well as the mortality in intensive care of subjects with "successful self-extubation" (defined as no re-intubation on D7) compared to those in "failure of" self-extubation ".

arm_group.description: Patients with unplanned extubation in the ICU

study_pop.textblock: Patients with occurrence of an unscheduled extubation (auto-extubation or accidental extubation) in the ICU

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years or older
- Mechanically ventilated with oral or nasotracheal intubation
- Occurrence of an unscheduled extubation (auto-extubation or accidental extubation)
- Extubation is defined as the removal of the orotracheal or nasotracheal tube with the impossibility of reinsertion of the same device.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Opposition to the use of personal data
- Pregnant women
- Person under protective custody or guardianship

facility.name: Hôpital La Pitié Salpêtrière- Département d'Anesthésie-Réanimation
